revised_title: Auzout's Critique on Hook's Optical Instrument Design
tldr: In this article, Monsieur Auzout critiques Mr. Hook's new instrument for grinding optical glasses, discussing its limitations and potential improvements. Auzout highlights the challenges of creating large, precise lenses and questions the effectiveness of Hook's turn-lathe design. He suggests possible modifications to improve the instrument's performance and expresses doubt about the feasibility of creating extremely long telescopes.
